intro: Fumaria bulbosa var. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate celandine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and distinctive, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a short, creeping stem and produces capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been historically used in herbal remedies.
